original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 296.75/297.25 to dollar at open, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 297 /297.50 against the US dollar in the spot market on Tuesday, while bond yields were steady, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 296.75 /297.25 to the US dollar on Monday after opening around 296.50 /297.50 rupees.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 was quoted at 26.50/75 percent steady from Monday’s close at 26.50/65 percent.
Sri Lanka’s rupee is appreciating amid negative private credit which has reduced outflows after the central bank hiked rates and stopped printing money. (Colombo/ May 30/2023)
